The authors note that 57 countries saw their CGGI scores drop between 2021 and 2025, with only five—UAE, Spain, Vietnam, Mongolia, and China—showing consistent improvement. Africa’s average governance score remains the lowest globally, with improvements in institutional strength but declines in financial stewardship, global reputation, and helping people rise.
